wikipedia_page.main: Henry Tassie (8 June 1863 – 26 October 1945) was an Australian politician. He was a member of the South Australian Legislative Council from 1918 to 1938, representing Central District No. 2 for three successive conservative parties: the Liberal Union, Liberal Federation and Liberal and Country League. He was Chief Secretary, Minister of Mines and Minister of Marine from 1927 to 1930 in the government of Richard Layton Butler.

response: * Henry Tassie MLC (Central No. 2 District) – lost preselection

Tassie was a son of Henry Tassie, who was a government minister in South Australia."MR. E. H. TASSIE DIES SUDDENLY", The Advertiser, 23 July 1936. He attended Way College, Adelaide, and played football for the school team and later for various lower-level clubs. An accountant by profession, Tassie became manager of the Norwood Football Club's B-grade team in 1912, and then in 1914 was elected club treasurer."Mr. Eric Tassie", The Journal, 25 May 1923. He became club secretary in 1919, holding that position until 1924, and was a club delegate to the South Australian Football League (SAFL) from 1920 until his death."MR. ERIC H. TASSIE", The News, 11 April 1925. Tassie managed the South Australian state team at the 1924 National Carnival,"INTERSTATE FOOTBALL CARNIVAL: Manager of South Australian Team.", The Register, 29 April 1924. and was a state selector on a number of other occasions.
